Posts.Content: hi all had my mastectomy yesterday and was home at 10.30 this morning with no drains, i feel great and was alert when i came round after the op. (i thought i would have been asleep all day) lol. the area around the op is filling with fluid a bit but is not sore breast care nurse ringing tomorrow will keep you posted love to you all angela
Posts.Title: New to group- so scared of whats to come...

Posts.Content: thanks for your replies, the runs have started lol, not long now, going to get in the bath. Just a thought, has anyone had a real hair wig and what is the price difference. i could murder a brew now lol. see you all soon, a little bit lighter on the scales to, bonus
Posts.Title: New to group- so scared of whats to come...

Posts.Content: hi all im new, n just want you all to know im going in for my mastectomy tomorow, im a bit scared of the results incase it has spread anywhere else, my cancer is a grade 3 hormone positive and her2  positive, also the lymph node they tested was also positive, dont really know how i should feel at the moment, i feel fine, im fine about the op, just scared incase it all comes crashing down round my ears. i also have been to try wigs on and at first got a littlle upset, but the wigs are fantastic, i was ready to shave my hair there and then,.they would be a lot easier than my own hair  it is curly so i streighten it all  the time, love to you all x angela x
Posts.Title: New to group- so scared of whats to come...

Posts.Content: ih i finished my chemo at the end of november, just finished my radiotherapy, my herceptin is still ongoing ive had eight doses. the only side effect i can say is that my hair is coming back a lot slower than my friends who are not having herceptin. so no real side effects with herceptin im glad to say. hope your keeping well xxx
Posts.Title: Worried about starting herceptin, what should I expect?

Posts.Content: Hi Angela im eight week post DIEP op, mine was delayed 6 years, it was the best thing I have done but I knew from the very beginning that this is what I wanted when all my treatment was done. The surgeon I first chose was a man and I was told I needed to loose 2.5 stone but due to life and tamoxifen I found this very hard to do, to cut a long story short he would not perform the surgery unless I lost the weight so really I think I just gave up, then one day out of the blue I had a phone call off the hospital to go and see another surgeon, so I took myself and my daughter off to see the lady and what a wonderful person she was, she greeted me with a hug  and couldnt understand why they had told me to loose so much weight, im a big lady I weighed 14.5 stone, the surgeon told me to go home and put weight on the bigger the belly the bigger the boob, I am a 38 F at the minute. Needless to say I went home with a smile on my face lol. I had been put on her waiting list which was about 12 month but she was definitely worth waiting for. I actually waited only 8 month when I got the call I was so excited. I went into the hospital the night before and they explained what they was going to do, they was doing the diep and a reduction on my right breast, I was so excited that night I couldn't sleep lol. I went down for surgery at ten o clock and came back up at six thirty, I was fine my husband and family was there to great me, I was chatting to them for a couple of hours till I got tired and they went home. I didn't really look at my new boob till the next day and I didn't feel it properly till then, the nurses kept saying it was a big flap lol, I didn't have any pain and didn't need pain meds at home for the surgery but I did need pain meds for the back ache took me a couple of weeks to get my sleep back to normal. I didn't have the reduction done at the same time, this will be done at a later date, I have had no restrictions with movement and was home on day four. This is the best decision I have made and I am grateful for all the surgical team who helped me achieve my new boobie or as I like to call them pinky and perky. Hope this has helped you and anyone else who is looking to have the surgery, if you need any more info please ask, I am doing a photo diary of my progress to.

Posts.Title: Delayed reconstruction

Posts.Content: hi im just writing this to see how many people have been left with permanent hair loss after chemotherapy. im two years out from my last chemo, my hair has grown back round the back and sides but it is very thin. It is very sparse on top like male pattern balding.  I am unable to go without a wig and was wondering what other people are doing about the situation, I have been refused funding for an hair system three times because it is not under extreme circumstances. Any feed back would be lovely, also what type of wigs do you ladies prefer ie full lace, monofilament etc etc.
Posts.Title: permanent hair loss

Posts.Content: hi jules i was diagnosed 17 march,  had left mastectomy with full lymph node clearence on 4 th april and my first chemo 30th june, im still feeling good, shaved my hair off today, and quite like it lol the chemo im on is EC x 4 then 4 docetaxel along with herceptin because iwas her2 pos and hormone pos. hope you are feeling good, i go for my next chemo on thursday, c what that will bring. xx take care n b strong
Posts.Title: hair falling out

Posts.Content: well peeps its day 15 since my first chemo and my hair has started to come out, how long does it take to all come out . ive been really well after 1st chemo with just a tad sickley on the day of infusion, and lack of taste buds for the first week. Hope these are the only side effects ill get. hope everyone is well and keeping strong. xx
Posts.Title: hair falling out

Posts.Content: hi jules thanks for the reply, when was you diagnosed and are you still goin through treatment, x
Posts.Title: hair falling out

Posts.Content: hi all, well its my second lot of chemo tomorrow, ive still got a full head of hair although its a bit thin on the right side. i shaved it of with a number six and have worn it like this up to now ,maybe i will loose it all after the next chemo. I still have all other hair except my lady tash and the few hairs on my chin have gone, thank god, will update soon take care  xx
Posts.Title: hair falling out

Posts.Content: hi micheala, im 46 yr old and had my breast removed april of this yr, im about to have my last chemo on monday, if i can help in anyway just let me know, im also her2 positive and hormone positive. good luck with your treatment x
Posts.Title: her2 positive help
